author: mbk
msg: Consolidate usage of apr_uid_name_get and apr_uid_homepath_get into svn
wrapper functions, fixing a few bugs along the way.
(subcommand_rmlocks): Call svn_user_get_name(), and thus fix a latent bug
where username could be used uninitialized.
(get_tunnel_user): Call svn_user_get_name(), and thus fix a latent bug due

author: maxb
msg: * STATUS: Yet more nominations from me.

author: maxb
msg: Fix numerous bugs in the svn_fs_*berkeley*() APIs.
Fix issue 2361 (recover on a FSFS repository errors if BDB not linked).
Fix creation of BDB files in FSFS repositories by 'svnadmin recover',
Fix improper design of placing bdb_set_errcall in the fs_library vtable, rather
svn_fs_hotcopy_berkeley() capable of operating on non-berkeley repositories
- this may seem strange, but is the easiest sane behaviour to give these
functions, rather than blindly performing BDB-type operations. It is also
what we ought to have done originally from a design perspective, to allow
programs built on the 1.0 API to access FSFS repositories without recoding.
***** FS module vtable change. If an old 1.3.0-dev build of libsvn_fs_foobar
***** is picked up by a new 1.3.0-dev build of libsvn_fs, nasty stuff will
Deprecate. Explain in doc why this function is redundant.
(fs_library_vtable_t): Move member bdb_set_errcall out of this vtable...
NULL is not a valid return value, return a zero-element array instead.
(svn_fs_hotcopy): Read the fs-type file only once, and cause a fs-type
file to be added to the destination even if the source was a 1.0 repository
created before the inception of fs-type files.
behaviour into this deprecated code path.
(svn_fs_open_berkeley): Allow to correctly open any fs-type, rather than
creating bogus Berkeley DB environment files inside a FS of any other type.
(svn_fs_delete_berkeley): Turn into an alias of svn_fs_delete_fs(), rather
than running the Berkeley delete code on the FS regardless of type.
(svn_fs_hotcopy_berkeley): Turn into an alias of svn_fs_hotcopy(), rather
than blindly attempting to perform a hotcopy in the Berkeley DB fashion
API for the correct FS provider module, instead of always executing the
BDB implementation, which resulted in the bogus creation of BDB environment
files inside FSes of other types.
(svn_fs_set_berkeley_errcall): Execute the appropriate API for the correct FS
provider module, instead of always executing the BDB implementation, which
resulted in memory corruption due to libsvn_fs_base being given another

author: maxb
msg: Fix issue 2406 - Do not pass URL-encoded hostname to ra_svn tunnel agent.
portion of URL before using it to construct tunnel agent argv.
